message.content:
cs.IR, cs.DL, cs.SI, cs.CY, cs.SD 

This paper is likely to belong to the Information Retrieval (cs.IR) sub-category as it deals with the development of an interface to the US Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) that allows for the mapping of patent portfolios. It also involves the use of freeware programs for visualization, which is a common technique in the field of Information Retrieval. 

It could also belong to the Digital Libraries (cs.DL) sub-category as it deals with the construction of basemaps from citation relations among patents contained in a database. 

The paper may also be relevant to the Social and Information Networks (cs.SI) sub-category as it involves the analysis of technological distance and diversity in portfolios. 

The Cybersecurity (cs.CY) sub-category is also a possibility as the USPTO database contains sensitive information that needs to be protected. 

Finally, the Software Engineering (cs.SE) sub-category could be relevant as the paper discusses the development of an interface and the use of freeware programs for visualization, which are common practices in software engineering.
